text: Ophlin Russell (born on January 2, 1962), better known as Sister Nancy (or Muma Nancy), is a Jamaican dancehall DJ and singer. She is best known to the world as the first female dancehall DJ and described as being a "dominating female voice for over two decades" on the dancehall scene.https://www.washingtonpost.com/ac2/wp- dyn/cityguide/profile?id=1126126&p;=print One of her most famous songs is Bam Bam, which is labeled as a "well-known reggae anthem" by BBC and a "classic" by The Observer. ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:DJs Category:Jamaican reggae musicians Category:Jamaican singers
title: Sister Nancy
